website_summaries.verdict: Instead of batteries, this keyboard charges with a lightning cable - an intriguing yet pricey option.
pros: Operates within a good range, with smaller keys lend themselves to faster typing
cons: Smaller keys can be difficult for those with larger hands/fingers
Arrow keys have an awkward placement

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, but it was used
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this, but it clearly was used when it arrived, so I returned it the same day.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Two defective keyboards in a row
customer_reviews.text: The Apple Care troubleshooter said not to order the keyboard from Amazon, as they are not an authorized seller of Apple products. Multiple dead keys in both keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: James Glickman

customer_reviews.title: best apple keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I ever had. I had for decades invested in happy hacking keyboards as I like to have on all machines and operating systems the same keyboard allowing to save time and aggrevation. The apple magic keyboard very flat, has everything at the right place and looks good. I'm really excited because the keyboard now connects via lightening - USB cable to the desktop. Bluetooth only was for me always terrible, as the batteries would go out or shake and lose connection, or have multiple keyboards interfere with each other. One can now use the keyboard with or without bluetooth. I'm writing this on this keyboard on a linux desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Typical overpriced Apple accessory
customer_reviews.text: Keys have a lower profile, action, and feel much more flimsy compared to the usb apple keyboard that this replaced. Keys also produce more noise and have more lateral movement (i.e., it feels cheap, unlike the sturdy and quiet older keyboard). The space bar is too skinny and I sometimes hit the command key by mistake. An extra "fn" key was squeezed into the left side, hence the shorter space bar. Otherwise, the "Magic" keyboards are the only ones apple makes, so we're stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Drew

customer_reviews.title: Improves upon a great design.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Apple's keyboards. The clean lines and smooth edges look perfect on any desk. This new keyboard is a great addition to an already excellent line of keyboards. The new model introduces a Lightning port on the top-back edge of the device that lets you charge the internal battery. No more having to change out batteries! This also lets you use it as a wired keyboard, for those times when you want to access your non-Apple computer's BIOS during boot or with machines that don't have Bluetooth capabilities. This keyboard will work with Windows computers, but be aware that the Function keys for adjusting brightness, volume, etc. will not work in Windows natively.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton M.

customer_reviews.title: Who splits the up and down arrows into tiny, useless half-keys?
customer_reviews.text: I have to wonder if any programmer at Apple ever touched this keyboard before it went out. Instead of taking the high road and finding a key arrangement that works, some lazy designer put the up and down arrows in the space of one key and split them into tiny half-keys. Sometimes I wonder if Tim is actually trying to make Steve roll over in his grave.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Worked good while it worked but died after three months. Just died.
customer_reviews.author: John Conway

customer_reviews.title: Apple! Wireless! Rechargeable!! What more could you want?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Rechargeable Keyboard to replace the previous generation Apple Wireless Keyboard. I got tired of changing the batteries in the Wireless Keyboard so I replaced it with this Rechargeable Keyboard. The Apple Magic Keyboard (rechargeable) uses a different type of key and I had to get used to the new feel of this keyboard. It wasn't immediate for me but that's normal when adjusting to new keyboards. The Arrow Keys are different on this keyboard -- like the MacBook Pro's keyboard. Overall, I am pleased with the Apple Magic Keyboard (rechargeable) and look forward to years of use (as the previous model lasted).
customer_reviews.author: Hike

customer_reviews.title: As other people of said, the ergonomics on this ...
customer_reviews.text: As other people of said, the ergonomics on this is all whack, unless you're a child, it's just too small for fingers...
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a few days that I’ve bought and used this keyboard and I love it! Same layout as MBP and useful when the laptop is docked and connected to multiple monitors. I should buy that sooner. It’s a little over-price (typical apple product) but still is cheaper on Amazon👌
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: quality apply product
customer_reviews.text: i have a new home computer set up and needed a keyboard. i was going to cheap out but decided at the end apple makes quality and i wanted something that would last a long time and keep me happy. it's an improvement over the butterfly keyboard on my laptop and i like the fact that it's always connected and doesn't sleep like the cheap alternatives i read about
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Chin

customer_reviews.title: CHECK First -Problem was u,i,o,j,k,l,m keys not working
customer_reviews.text: My IMAC keys u,i,o,j,k,l,m keys were not working and I went into panic mode because I could not login . I was able to get on the on screen keyboard working and ordered the replacement keyboard from Amazon. Amazingly it was delivered in several hours the same day. The installation/pairing was simple - plug in- but the same keys were not working. Performed an internet search and the problem was that mouse keys were enabled. SYTEM PREFERENCES-ACCESSIBILITY-MOUSE & TRACK PAD- (deselect) MOUSE KEYS ENABLE Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: JKDUT

customer_reviews.title: It is too compact to be efficient and comfortable for typing
customer_reviews.text: I had previous two other wireless MAC labtop keyboards. This is my third one after one of the previous two died. I bought it based on the reviews, and did notice there were one or two commenting the sound or easiness of it. I have used it for several months now. I am still not used to it. It is just too small for normal adult fingers to type fast and mistake free. I don't even have big hands as small size person myself. I still like my old Mac keyboard. I don't understand who designed this one. I think it is a mistake. If you are thinking of buying one, I strongly suggest to go for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: SpringJ

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn't mind the price and bought it earlier
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I purchased thus far! Clean design, very responsive, easy to setup. I use this keyboard everyday and the battery life is so long, I don't remember exactly the last time I charged it (maybe more than a month ago). Very responsive, it wakes up instantly when I press a button, and doesn't eat words when I type really fast!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight Function keys don't work
customer_reviews.text: The function keys F10, F11, and F12 on this keyboard, no longer control the sound and volume for the computer. There are keys I use all the time! This keyboard is too light weight and I cannot use it on the arm of my chair which is what I have done for 10 years now. I always used the older version of the keyboard which takes batteries. I will take batteries any day over this re-chargeable one. It has weight to it. I Love Apple products, but someone slipped up with making this rechargeable style too light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Birdlover

customer_reviews.title: Completely unresponsive after a couple weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Well, I liked this keyboard but it completely stopped working after two weeks of use. It was definitely fully charged and even if I had it plugged in it would not respond. I was able to connect my previous keyboard (the Apple wireless keyboard that takes AA batteries) with no issues so it was definitely an issue with this keyboard. Wondering if they're selling refurbished keyboards? I was surprised considering the high rating on this item. Overall rating is based on reliability of product from this source.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my PC (which I know is blasphemy) and it is far and away the best keyboard I have ever used in my life. I had a problem with calcific tendinitis in my shoulder from my keyboard use that went away after switching to this keyboard. In fact, a lot of pain and problems I was having from using my keyboard went away the moment I switched to this. I can't recommend it highly enough, even if you use a PC. It has to be the best keyboard ever made, seriously. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Dont BUY
customer_reviews.text: Every once in a while keys won't work, when I'm trying to type an essay, the keeps kinda "freezes" if you prefer
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original Apple wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my MacBook Air as I already have the original Apple wireless keyboard (MC184LL/B) for my iMac. Didn't expect much more, but this keyboard really is better than the first. They keys feel better, type better, i like how the keyboard is flat, and I love not having to change out dead batteries. Also convenient is the ability to use it while it's plugged in. I've owned the product for a few days and haven't observed any connection issues. Will update the post if I come across any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Compact, cute, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got nervous after seeing reviews that they received a used product, but mine was brand new. I’m a copywriter so my career is based off of writing, and this cute little compact keyboard makes it so seamless and easy. Highly recommended because you can spend $50 on a bad keyboard today, and have to replace it in less than a year. This one will last for a long time. They’re more expensive because of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: I like this Apple keyboard a lot more than any other keyboard I use. If there was one that worked with Windows, I'd consider using it too. To me, the best part of it is that it doesn't take up a lot of space on my desk. Additionally it helps separate my mindset from work (using a Mac) and home (using Windows), which I felt was very important especially during these times in the pandemic. But unfortunately after about ~6months of usage the keyboard's space button started to sporadically not register. For nearly $100 I'd say you're buying everything but the quality.
customer_reviews.author: UNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Great for skinny finger people
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this keyboard except for the arrow keys in the bottom right corner. I have thicker fingers and can’t ever seem to hit the arrow key I’m aiming for. Considering finger surgery just so I can make this keyboard work better for me. My mom says my fingers are fine just the way they are and that it’s what’s on the inside that counts, but I blame her for my chubby fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Apple, really?
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is light enough but is by no means portable. The keyboard's aluminum body edges are so sharp that it's not comfortable to pick up with your hands. I almost want to get a nail filer and smooth off the sharp edges. I am very surprised that this is an Apple design. It was also very loud when I typed a few words (with very cheap plasticky feel and sound). I don't think I could use this keyboard for any lengthy writing projects. This is definitely not for serious writers. Returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Good portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very portable keyboard and easy to use with the Mac system. It's nice that it has the shortcuts printed on the F keys the same way it shows on the actual Macbook keyboard so that I can continue the use the shortcuts when my Macbook is closed without needing to memorize the positions. One con is that the minimalistic design makes it not ergonomic to type on for speed and duration. Since the keyboard is not elevated, it oftentimes does not register keypress of keys that require a longer reach due to insufficient actuation force.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chen

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-up
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Apple keyboard and it connected to my IMAC right away: took only seconds to get it set up and going. Every key seems to function properly. I am using OS X El Capitan. Was powered to 94% upon receipt so could start typing right away without the cord. To set-up to connect to your MAC, you need to plug it into a USB port. It was super easy and I've very pleased. The keyboard is flatter than my prior keyboard that came with the IMAC, but it is an easy adjustment. Using it right now to type out this review.
customer_reviews.author: Cartoonist Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Responsive keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The magic Apple keyboard is outstanding. I use it with my Windows 10 PC. It is responsive and comfortable. Minimal footprint (which I like). Typical Apple product in that it is high end, though through well, and not a lot of fluff. Highly recommend for anyone who wants a small keyboard. My only complaint is there is only one “control” button.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Beware of compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: This is not compatible with my Mac OS X 10.8.5. This information of compatibility should have been included in this page. I had to return and now the search is on for a compatible keyboard. 😷
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. For my work computer I have the larger size of this keyboard with the numbers and it’s nice but I don’t use the number side of it as often so for my personal computer I opted for this smaller one. I really like it. It fits my desk well the keys have a nice click and well it’s apple so looks are great.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I'll give three reviews because it's good to type on
customer_reviews.text: doesn't work well with windows, has a lag on dell computer, connection issues when inactive and start up again. I'll give three reviews because it's good to type on, comfortable and when it did work the keys were responsive and typed as intended. returned because need something that works well with windows computer without having to install additional software
customer_reviews.author: johnykarate

customer_reviews.title: Works, connects seamlessly.
customer_reviews.text: It does not have the expected resistance, but then, I learned to type on an old manual typewriter in Miss Shmitze high school typing class, in 1959. The wold has changed a bit since then. I write a lot, and it works just fine. Adjust to change in the world or die. Think I’ll stick around and see what’s new.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: Great & so easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and is very compact which I love! The only thing that may take some getting used to is the keys, because you don't have to press very hard at all and they don't compress very far, it works very well though! The keyboard powers on/off with a little switch on the front, and the battery life is 30 days+ and you can charge it with an iphone charger cord. Also the bluetooth is so easy, all you do is turn on your bluetooth, then click on the icon on your computer and say "connect keyboard" and if you turn on your keyboard before the computer is turned on, it seems to connect on its own...
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard , not many function keys work with iPadOS.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard for my iPad now that it supports keyboards, mice, and touchpad. The keyboard is more Mac OS friendly then IOS because I noticed some specialty keys don’t work in IOS. It’s a nice little Bluetooth keyboard that connects easily and has really nice size keys for a small keyboard. The tactile feel is also very good unlike those terrible butterfly keys on MacBooks. As always though its priced higher because of the Apple branding.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard powered up ok, but the middle keys are not responsive at all.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard powered up ok, but the middle keys are not responsive at all. Obviously, nobody checked it before being shipped. Just a waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.author: PAUL JAEGER

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life isn't great
customer_reviews.text: Battery life isn't great. I'm not sure if it's the keyboard issue. I charged it everyday. Ideally, this kind of keyboard shouldn't lowbat fast. I have 2 Mac devices, I hope I can easily switch bluetooth if I want to switch back and forth from the devices. Anyway, my concern was just battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ray A

customer_reviews.title: the correct keyboard for you Mac
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 2 year old Mac, needed a new keyboard. Good price, perfect keyboard. Free S&H through Amazon Prime, arrived in 1 day. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Sifu Wagener

customer_reviews.title: super convenient, although pricey
customer_reviews.text: if you care about convenience + portability, get this. (this was me) if ALL you care about is CONVENIENCE, get the expanded version with numeric keys, because i gotta admit this keyboard is compact (especially the arrow keys), so I definitely make typos more often with this keyboard. if you have limited budget, get another keyboard from a 3rd party company.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn K.

customer_reviews.title: Keys Repeating on Their Own When I Type
customer_reviews.text: My previous Apple Magic Keyboard worked like a charm. When it finally died after 4 years of intense use, I bought this replacement. Only a few months later, the keys started repeating on their own. Touching one key would repeat that key over and over again at super fast speed. It is still under warranty, but I've never had success with Apple fixing anything, no matter how many times I sent it back. I think this is my last magic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Magic Keyboard many times before, so I knew what I was in for when ordering this one for my studio desk. As with most Apple products, it's more expensive than the competition but you get what you pay for and the build quality, packaging quality, and smoothness/responsiveness of the Magic Keyboard are unmatched. I got the variant without the numeric pad since I don't need one, and it's a perfectly portable size.
customer_reviews.author: Erik S.

customer_reviews.title: good feel, lasts long time on a charge
customer_reviews.text: geek review: i use 'vi' as my editor (yes, i'm a dinosaur) and the 2016 touchbar macbook pro puts the escape key on the touch bar. crippled me. external keyboard saved my sanity. <ESC> normal review: the external keyboard is great - same layout at home as work. i put the laptop up on a stand so the screen is more at eye level. keyboard has a good touch, no discernible lag, and a charge lasts for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: nsc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pair, never have any connection issues, and has a great feel to it. The one gripe I have is that it can't be paired to more than one device at a time, something that's easily reconcilable by simply plugging it in via USB<>Lightening to your desired computer. So, not a huge issue, and overall it's definitely a step up from other high-end bluetooth keyboards from Logitech and the like that I've used in the past which were plagued with connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to use. Any logitech keyboard is better than this and more decently priced.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Apple Magic Keyboard to use with my Macbook, but I've found its design not very ergonomic. The keyboard doesn't have feet so it's extremely flat, and it's length also makes hitting the right keys something to get used to. For the price, I've been pretty disappointed with this keyboard. I've since returned it and bought a Logitech keyboard (dedicated to Mac set up)-- I've found this a much better compromise for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: au

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky enough to find a new in box Apple Magic Keyboard in the "Used" section. The only "flaw" was the box had a couple of dings on it. The keyboard is perfect and I'm pretty sure it had never been out of the original box. In addition to saving over $45 from actual Apple retail price, the package was delivered in less than 24 hours. Win-win all around. This is a great keyboard - good key response, lightweight but sturdy and is easy to pack into my briefcase or my shoulder bag.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Finally broke down and bought it. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I kinda love it. I was using a full-sized Logitech wireless keyboard with my MacBook for work, and I have gotten so used to the smaller keyboard on my MacBook that I could barely function when I started using the external keyboard in my home office. I have been reluctant to spend close to $100 on the Magic Keyboard, but decided to save my sanity and buy it. No regrets. While pricey, it is hard to beat the Magic Keyboard and Magic Mouse for ease of use and convenience. If you live and die on your MacBook, you'll be glad you splurged.
customer_reviews.author: T. GraydonTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: This is a hardwired keyboard, something I failed to notice.
customer_reviews.text: Having had battery operated keyboards prior to this one, I'm actually enjoying this one more, even though it was a "mistake" of an order. I like not having to worry about low battery, nor having to feel bad about adding to the store of batteries in landfills. I had even tried rechargable batteries in the past, but glad to be back to hardwired. The keyboard itself is smooth and nice to operate.
customer_reviews.author: bookcrazy

customer_reviews.title: This key board is not a good product
customer_reviews.text: This key board stopped working all together. Won’t charge won’t type, sadly it worked great for the two times I used it. I wish that apple had a better experience for me to share, or a good exchange policy. Boo on Apple at the moment. I was using this for my Mac Book Air where the only two keys went out! Ugh 😩 my husband bought a key board for his iPad for like 30.00 and it’s worked ten times better then the apple one. So don’t waste 94.00 when you can get one no name brand that works better for 36.00. Hope this helps people not get ripped off ! Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keypad so that I could give my arms a better resting position and it is doing the trick thus far. The board itself was super easy to set up with my macbook air and the keys are sturdy. The only issue is I just bought a new macbook and apparently those don't have usb's so I won't be able to charge from my laptop, which is a bit of a bummer and the only reason this is not five stars. I have had it for 3 days and haven't had to recharge it because it barely uses any power.
customer_reviews.author: soooo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my MacAir. Fits in my computer sleeve with the laptop. If you have an Apple laptop, buy an Apple keyboard as the Apple shortcuts are on the keyboard. I have used other non-Apple keyboards with my Mac and found them to be cumbersome without the shortcuts.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Wiesehan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gift for Teens!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old grandson picked this as one of his Christmas gifts from me. He’s an expert in this field and is very knowledgeable about anything tech. He is totally satisfied with the quality as well as the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wyckoff

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you wanted
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I had my eye on this keyboard but thought it was a little expensive. I tried a couple of other wireless keyboards and I haven’t liked any of them. I finally bought this after spending almost the same amount as the cost of this keyboard and it’s amazing. This should have been my first pick. The battery is great and the keyboard itself is so sleek. If you’re considering this along with other keyboards, just go ahead and pick this one. It’ll save you money in the long run. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: very loud key action
customer_reviews.text: My older apple keyboard, the style that took the two AA batteries, finally died and got this to replace it. Equally high quality product and key action. The one exception is loud key action. Not first gen cherry key switches loud, but still loud enough for my partner to complain about the typing sounds. I am sure fans will swarm in that it isn't loud and I must be hitting the keys too hard because apple is perfect, but no, this is just a loud for a modern, non-gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JP Withers

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery -prob defective one
customer_reviews.text: I had to make a quick purchase for my work and I only noticed after a month that the battery is a poor one. Original would not need this much recharging this frequently. $100 for a keyboard with poor battery is thumbs down for me. I guess maybe I was sold a defective one but can't return it since its been over 30 days. Maybe this could be a warning for those buying it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Dead key
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews. I am very careful with my electronics and this worked fine for 2 months so I am giving a couple stars for that but now the b key is dead and I can't return it. I will buy from Apple to be sure I get a new keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Beachshooz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, no comparison to the cheaper alternatives
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the top-ranked Anker bluetooth keyboard and returned it due to lag time, though it was also a little noisy. I was not happy to pay $96 for this but needed a solution without compromise. I am VERY glad that I did. For a fast typer who likes a low profile, quiet keyboard, this is perfect. Pros - Beautiful - Quiet - No lag - Extremely slender Cons - Price
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth has stopped working and will not take a charge anymore. Only a month old.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy P

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Macbook Air 13" mid 2012 OSX 10.14.6
customer_reviews.text: I spilled coffee over my macbook air, to disastrous effect on its keyboard. Ordered the magic keyboard, plugged it in to pair and my problems are all solved! It has a good feel too. Works via bluetooth or with the lightning/ USB cable. My particular macbook air (mid 2012) wasn't mentioned in the compatibility list, but I've had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Diggler

customer_reviews.title: Small, efficient and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to apple products, but I love their design and functionality. The keyboard is small, and it gets charged while you use it, it’s a lot better than other Bluetooth keyboards that you either have to replace the battery or try to find the Bluetooth connection. You are better of buying this product, the real apple deal and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but am now on my third keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new iMac in fall of 2015, latest version. Love it, but am now on my third keyboard (Apple Magic Wireless Bluetooth Scissor-Switch Keyboard), each time one of the keys stopped working (i.e., not sending input). Fortunately I bought a warranty on the iMac, but I'm curious if anyone else has had this problem. Is it a product design defect, or am I the only unlucky one? The Genius told me she hadn't seen any other problems, but I've got to believe there's something up. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart S

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a new keyboard after my iMacs enter and shift keys quit working. So while I was waiting on this keyboard I bought a temporary one for both Mac/pc and OMG I hated it. I love these apple magic keyboards so much.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that it is rechargeable, but it REALLY needs a battery status indicator.
customer_reviews.text: The headline is my only real complaint. If it gets too low, it will drop the connection to an Apple TV and it is a real pain if it was the only remote tied to it. You can recover with an IOS device (iPhone), but it is not an obvious procedure. Even with this issue, it is a much better alternative to using disposable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Smith

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: It's Apple, what more is there to say. Great product, I'm addicted to Apple products because they work, they have free tech assistance is you're too dumb to figure it out yourself.
customer_reviews.author: theodore

customer_reviews.title: Quality product expected from Apple. It just works.
customer_reviews.text: Came in beautifully minimal & clean-cut "Apple" white box packaging. Turned it on and voila - the keyboard immediately connected with my mid-2010 Macbook Pro 15" and I was typing away. Keys are gentle and quiet, which I like, and though yes, the arrow keys are a bit different, I got used to it quickly. Thank you Apple!
customer_reviews.author: Eric honestly opinionated K.

customer_reviews.title: Great small form factor
customer_reviews.text: Great key travel and typing feel for such a small keyboard. Much thinner and lighter than I expected. So it has been great freeing up extra space on my desk with multiple workstations.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: good product - terrible shipper
customer_reviews.text: I paid retail price for this keyboard - $89 - but received a well-worn product. Scratched on both sides, stains on a couple keys, and the keys on the lower right don't work (right shift key, arrow keys, etc). On top of that it was still signed out to the previous owner. AND there was no recharge cable included - the cavity for it was empty! A pathetic experience.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes Slow Connection
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Apple Magic wireless keyboard for a few months now, and am mostly happy with it. The only issue I have is that sometimes it takes several minutes for my Mac to connect to it, after initially turning on the Mac. The built-in battery has a long life, and the keys feel good under my fingers. I'd give it 5 stars if only the connection time was more reliably quicker.
customer_reviews.author: W. COOl

customer_reviews.title: Avoid 3rd party, just get the Apple keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Connects easily and JUST WORKS, which is great. Every once in a while if my computer is on too long, it won't want to sync up, but that can usually be fixed by plugging it back into the computer or restarting the computer. The battery has a VERY long life to it, I haven't really tested it's full limits yet. Keystroke and key response is great, and yes, the arrow keys are arranged slightly differently from previous versions but it doesn't bother me at all. I finally caved and bought this after battling with a cheap bluetooth keyboard from Anker which would never stay connected. You get what you pay for, and this thing does what it is supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It is a great keyboard that is set up exactly as it's predecessor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my battery operated Apple Magic Keyboard that came with my computer when it was purchased in 2011. I'm sure it's malfunctioning keys were due to spills. I read all the negative reviews on this battery-free model, and I cannot understand where these people were coming from. It is a great keyboard that is set up exactly as it's predecessor. I'm on the computer a lot, and this rechargeable battery is very long lasting. My percentage is barely down from when I bought it. I bought keyboard covers, so I expect to get a very long life out of this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Torgrimson

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I got this instead of the one made for the iPad. It feels nice to type with, and I’m use to a mechanical keyboard. I use it to type long comments to parents after each of my tutor sessions. I’ve encountered no flaws, nor had the battery die on me. I’m not sure how to check how much of a charge it has, but it’s been going strong. Recommend, I will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Dante

customer_reviews.title: Wrist Saver!
customer_reviews.text: My Macbook Pro tends to run hot because of my external monitor, so I have a laptop cooler. This places the laptop high and at an angle. I use the keyboard in front of the laptop and it's at the perfect angle where my wrists feel comfortable. The battery life is great, and I also have the magic mouse, which makes the setup complete.
customer_reviews.author: GoogleBear

customer_reviews.title: This took some time to get used to, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This took some time to get used to, but I bought it form when I use my standing desk and Ipad. The depth is a little awkward and the key spacing is a bit different than my Macbook Pro meaning that it took a while before I got my fingers figured out when using it. This is still an issue every time I switch over to it, but the time it takes to get used to it is decreasing. It charges quickly and if you plug it in it actually syncs with the Macbook automatically.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: great find
customer_reviews.text: was about to buy it on the Apple store, but found it on here and it was less expensive. Came in original packaging- I know some people said that theirs was in what looked like re-packaged boxes missing the plastic, but I had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Mstays

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to battery replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard from Apple. If you hate replacing batteries, get this one since it’s rechargeable and lasts for a very long time. Ours has been going strong for more than 2 months. Well worth the price since you’ll save it in batteries and time. Connection is solid and quick. No issues on my 2015 MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Chinorican

customer_reviews.title: Fine but Loud
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but it is much louder when typing than my old apple wireless keyboard. I don't like that at all because I'm often on calls with clients and type notes as we speak. Otherwise, it seems to work the same. I do like that it's chargeable rather than having to replace batteries. It's fine but I was quite happy with my old keyboard until it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Carla R

customer_reviews.title: Died after little use
customer_reviews.text: I used this for 2 months total before it died. Wouldn't turn on and would not charge. Since I did not start using it right away I could not return it.
customer_reviews.author: vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Do not let this peripheral device get wet, not even to clean it..
customer_reviews.text: This is my second magic keyboard. The first keyboard lasted 10 years. Stopped working when I decided to clean it. So, be sure to use screen cleaning wipes, or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Sylvester-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up; love the wireless
customer_reviews.text: After using this keyboard, it's hard to imagine going back to using a keyboard with a wire. This keyboard is easy to move around with my laptop or a lap desk or elsewhere. I also love how easy this keyboard is to charge and set up with a device. The keyboard is clean looking and a compact size, so it doesn't take up a lot of space (it doesn't include the number keypad, but I don't miss it).
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: arrow key button fell off..
customer_reviews.text: The down arrow key just fell off, on hold with apple now to see if it can be fixed. Wasn't mishandled or used much. Also the power seemed to drain very, very, very, quickly, where my older 2012 iMac keyboard lasts for months before we have to charge. Might have been used or something. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard for any Mac
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard for make computer, I love the looks and style, looking stunning on a desk. I was indecisive on wether to get the full key board or this one. I’m glade I chose the smaller version as this was the original that came with my 2017 Mac. The battery life is amazing I charge it only like 3-4 time a year
customer_reviews.author: ScenTyle

customer_reviews.title: It's a keyboard. It works.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard feels good and sturdy. Battery holds for about a week (if you can remember to turn it off when you get up).
customer_reviews.author: Reed Hartman

customer_reviews.title: works Ok, some peculiarities.
customer_reviews.text: There is an annoying momentary delay when striking a key after a down time. I knew that (review spoke of it) when i bought it, certain it wouldn't be a big deal as the price was right. I had to change the batteries and after that I couldn't connect it to my Mac. So that was that. I ended up buying the apple keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Helen S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but where is the wireless 10 key version?
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, compact and sleek looking keyboard. I like that they increased the size of the left and right arrow buttons as well as the function keys on top. I really wish they would make a version that has a 10 key. At this time I value the clean, wireless free look over the convenience of the 10 key. Battery life seems to be excellent. I'm a software developer and use it thoroughly. I haven't charged it in 3 weeks and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: The Muffin Man

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard for my wife (I'm a PC type) when her previous "mini" keyboard died. She liked the size of the old one, and this looked like it would suffice. This is superior to her old one, in that it charges by USB, it's more compact (no battery bump on the top), and finally she can use the "J" key. All in all, a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for mac users
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for mac users. I have been a heavy user of using my macbook pro's keyboard and decided to try this. The keyboard is amazing, and I am loving it already. I can connect my keyboard using bluetooth and use the keyboard without any issue. The keyboard has amazing battery life. The keys are butterfly keys that help type faster.
customer_reviews.author: Swapnil Shah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MacBook pro
customer_reviews.text: Easy to charge and use. I actually share it between 2 laptops, and it is easy to switch by just plugging to USB, and then unplug for wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Franchomme

customer_reviews.title: F function Keys not working
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is an issue for anyone else. But none of my function keys work what so ever. I have debugged, removed from Bluetooth, directly plugged into my mac desktop, followed ever guide online to try and fix it, tried changing the keyboard preferences and nothing and I mean nothing has worked to fix this issue. I will either get a 'bloop' sound when I try to use one of the keys is nothing. The only thing works is the normal letter keys, control, shift, and such but all the keys on the top line do nothing. That includes the power and the esc key. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Better made USB power cords, so far
customer_reviews.text: The success comes from an extension or flexable rubber around the ends of the USB cord. Past experience is that's the weak point of these cords. It forays at the ends not in the middle. I hope these really are as good as I think they are. I'll write an update should they fail.
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: Apple hits another out of the ballpark
customer_reviews.text: I love the apple keyboard. Being able to charge this is a huge plus as I had the battery one before. Honestly, it lasts so long that I feel like I never have to charge it. It has the quality and feel of an apple product. It is a bit on the expensive side for a keyboard but I don't mind paying it because I knew it would work so well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about getting a rechargeable mouse rather than battery-operated, but it lasts a very long time and works great! It does so many more things than a regular mouse, so I also recommend looking up the you-tube tutorials and learning all the cool things it can do, but I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Hettie B

customer_reviews.title: It’s apple.  I love it.
customer_reviews.text: My iMac keyboard got flooded with Diet Coke. Amazon had this replacement to me the next day. It fit right in - though I had to upgrade the OS to use it. Also, it’s rechargeable - so no more piles of emergency AA batteries!
customer_reviews.author: OWen

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is exactly what is advertised. It works well, holds a long charge, and is ergonomically designed
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the other reviews saying this looked like resold used items. My keyboard arrived very well packaged (no external damage to packaging) but busted with visible damage to the keys. I'd recommend buying elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: wob

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I recharge the keyboard once every 3 months or so. You could almost forget it's rechargeable. Makes you wish all chargeable devices were this efficient. Keys have a great feel and I don't think I could use another keyboard again. Keys do get dirty easily though and hard to clean. I think mine are permanently stained.
customer_reviews.author: Czinsy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. I have a Mac with a butterfly keyboard that I hate that always gets stuck keys. Decided to get a trusty Magic keyboard and so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard super light weight
customer_reviews.text: Love it and couldn't have bought a better one but I wish it could have been backlit also the back gets scratched up easy but worth it couldn't have bought anything better!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rodas

customer_reviews.title: Best Apple Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on a Mac Mini. I love the low profile and feel of the keys. This is the best keyboard ever.
customer_reviews.author: Sedona Resident

customer_reviews.title: My first time using this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. It does take some getting used to. When I first started typing on it I would hit the letters next to the actual letter I was trying to hit. But you get used to it. Overall. I'm enjoying this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: I love Apple products
customer_reviews.text: I love Apple products. I have a MPB, an iMac, an iPhone, and an iPad. I also have both the magic keyboard and a magic trackpad. Frankly, I don't like either of them. (Actually, I don't even really like the magic mouse, either). The problem is that they are too sleek. Apple has made them so thin that they rest virtually flat on the desk. For some reason this ends up hurting my wrists unless I prop them up on something. Otherwise, it leaves my wrists at an awkward angle that starts to hurt after a few moments. Maybe it is just my wrists or something, but this is one case where I feel thinner is not necessarily better.
customer_reviews.author: Drew2211Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not Much of An Upgrade for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A little overpriced but much more comfortable to use than the previous generation. That's about the only pro to this upgrade. So how can you justify paying double what you would pay for the previous version? Well.... You can't, really. There's only 3 things that have improved this keypad: +no more batteries to replace. Rechargeable Usb connector cord plugs into your computer +aesthetically pleasing design that no longer rocks when on an uneven surface +comfortable/compact design
customer_reviews.author: XX

customer_reviews.title: Beats constantly replacing batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Same nice keyboard as before, a little slimmer. On my iMac, the charge level is shown in 'System Preferences'. So it is easy to determine when to plug it in to any USB charger. It fully charges while I sleep. My only worry is what to do when the internal battery finally dies; well that's for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cyril C. Penn

customer_reviews.title: It's the best keyboard out there
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it. It's the best keyboard out there. Amazing battery life. Plug it in once a month for a few minutes and you're good. Compact size is so much better vs the keypad. Finally, it clicks just right and it's easy to glide while typing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Eph

customer_reviews.title: Sticking keys
customer_reviews.text: lasted two months and one day - now repeating problems with sticking keys - never the same one
customer_reviews.author: Phantom

product_meta.title: Apple Magic Keyboard (Wireless, Rechargable) (US English) - Silver
feature_bullets: Magic Keyboard combines a sleek design with a built-in rechargeable battery and enhanced key features.
With a stable scissor mechanism beneath each key, as well as optimized key travel and a low profile, Magic Keyboard provides a remarkably comfortable and precise typing experience.
It pairs automatically with your Mac, so you can get to work right away.
